attributes.action: immediately remove the comfort zone around our politicians by making it possible for members in the majority at any time in the House of Commons to be able to force a vote.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The debate day following the Queens Speech this year was more or less completely devoid of Labour members.  The Tory members were in the majority and therefore they should have been in a position to force a vote.  They represent the people, they were in the majority (through total lack of interest on the part of Labour) therefore whomsoever is in the the majority at that point in time should, by law, be able to call the shots!  The House of Commons has retrograded to nothing more than a talking shop and this atmosphere has to be reversed by the removal of the certainty that nothing can happen while they are not there.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
